ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Building of grammatical knowledge and vocabulary knowledge, advanced readings and speaking skills.
Spanish grammar rules and vocabulary! This course was a great second introduction.

I thoroughly enjoyed taking Spanish 120. I had a great time getting to know my classmates and my professor. We all had similar levels of Spanish competence and we grew together in the process of learning a new language. I learned how to communicate better with my peers, and also learned valuable time management skills.

I learned how to conjugate and use almost all tenses in the Spanish language. I learned several new vocabulary words and was able to practice my Spanish in class. I also learned about the healthcare systems in Bolivia, Honduras, and Argentina for my cultural project!
Expanded on content learned in SPAN 110: more tenses, sentence structures, vocabulary.
Spanish

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Engaging, cultural perspectives, value of historical knowledge, building of essential language skills, clear structure and calendar
Weaknesses: unclear expectations at times, Supersite homework is confusing and unhelpful, unclear expectations for exams.

The class focused a lot on grammar and culture which was nice. I didn't like that the class was centered around completing worksheets and grammar powerpoints. Given that we learned the grammar beforehand for homework, the class felt very repetitive.

Strengths- accessibility to course material
Weaknesses- overwhelming material for a single exam, at times

The strengths of this course included the curriculum and the asynchronous learning days. The intensive learning process helped me get better at learning Spanish. And, the asynchronous Wednesdays helped me apply the learning outside of the classroom.

Strengths - Linguameetings on asycnh Wednesdays, good organization, awesome cultural project, Profesora Reymundi is the best!
Areas for improvement - more casual speaking in class for as much speaking practice as possible! The supersite assigments were often much too long encouraging quick poor-quality work over high-quality work.
Strengths: peer-interaction based activities, asynchronous workdays, class powerpoints going over grammar; Weaknesses: some unclear instructions on major assignments.
Good balance of workload to force learning of the language

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, helpful in building linguistic skills.
Yes, especially if you're just looking to fulfill your language requirement.
Yes, this course was a great second introduction to the Spanish language. I found my skills expanded exponentially.

I would recommend this course to another student. It is admittedly tough and you have to really apply yourself to get a good grade. Yet, the benefits of learning Spanish are undeniable and it is definitely worth the effort compared to other language credits you could get at Yale.

Yes - Profesora Reymundi is really wonderful and the class is a good opportunity to solidify and add to your knowledge from Spanish I. Though it is 1.5 credits so beware the workload is high with supersite assignments every night.

I would recommend this class to another student if they need to fulfill their language requirement and are interested in Spanish. I felt I learned a lot and that the class environment was very light-hearted and supportive while also building my knowledge.
Only if you want to learn Spanish
